content.user_title: Build a Claude Code plugin structure
content.value_statement: Your plugin files feel disorganized and components do not load. This skill explains structure, manifest rules, and path usage so plugins load correctly.
actual_capabilities: Explain required plugin directory layout and component folders
Describe required and recommended fields for plugin.json
Clarify auto discovery rules for commands, agents, skills, hooks, and MCP servers
Provide naming conventions and portability rules using ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}
Offer troubleshooting checks for components that do not load
limitations: Does not generate files or run scripts
Does not validate manifests against a schema
Focuses on Claude Code plugin architecture only
Examples may need adaptation for your project

use_cases.title: Scaffold a new plugin
use_cases.description: Create a clean directory layout and manifest that Claude Code can discover automatically.

use_cases.title: Standardize plugin layouts
use_cases.description: Align multiple contributors on consistent naming, paths, and component organization.

use_cases.title: Fix loading issues
use_cases.description: Troubleshoot missing commands, agents, or skills by checking paths and frontmatter.

prompt_templates.title: New plugin basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the minimal directory layout and plugin.json fields needed for a Claude Code plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Add skills correctly
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to structure the skills folder and SKILL.md so Claude Code loads skills automatically.

prompt_templates.title: Custom paths in manifest
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an example of plugin.json commands paths and explain how custom paths supplement defaults.

prompt_templates.title: Portability review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my plan and list where to use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} and where not to use it.

output_examples.input: Explain how to structure a plugin so commands and skills load.
output: Required root folders and where they live
How commands and skills are auto discovered

best_practices: Keep plugin.json minimal unless you need custom paths
Use kebab case for all component names
Use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for all intra plugin paths
anti_patterns: Using absolute paths or home shortcuts in scripts
Naming skills without a SKILL.md file

faq.question: Is this compatible with Codex and Claude Code?
faq.answer: It targets Claude Code plugin structure and is useful for Codex users working with Claude Code plugins.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not create files or validate manifests.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with an existing plugin?
faq.answer: Apply the layout and manifest guidance, and update paths to use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides instructions and does not access files unless you share them.

faq.question: My components do not load. What should I check?
faq.answer: Confirm folder names, extensions, frontmatter, and that plugin.json paths start with ./.

faq.question: How is this different from a scaffold tool?
faq.answer: A scaffold tool creates files, while this skill explains structure and best practices.
